question.xref: DES s10, DES s11, HC r126

explanation.text:
‘Tailgating’ is used to describe this dangerous practice, often seen in fast-moving traffic and on motorways. Following the vehicle in front too closely is dangerous because it
• restricts your view of the road ahead
• leaves you no safety margin if the vehicle in front slows down or stops suddenly.

answer.text: using the rear door of a hatchback car
driving with rear fog lights on
